abstracts.cdata!:
The project would: (a) provide foreign
            exchange financing for high priority imports (spare parts,
            equipment, fertilizers, etc.) to help increase utilization
            of productive capacity in the irrigated agriculture
            subsector from which Sudan derives the bulk of its foreign
            exchange earnings; (b) encourage macro-economic and
            agriculture sector policy and institutional reforms; and (c)
            provide financing for technical assistance to help implement
            the program. The main risks involved are existing procedures
            and institutional constraints that tend to impede effective
            project execution in agriculture by preventing timely
            procurement and delivery of urgently needed inputs. The
            project would help mitigate these difficulties through
            institutional and policy reforms and through provision of
            technical assistance for tendering and procurement.
